parameters: air06
air05
\N<Segi>...
\N<Ryuda Soldier>Well... there's something I need to say before the battle.

\N<Ryuda Soldier>Segi, you are aware that a special exception has been made
for your participation in the battle, right?
\N<Segi>...

\N<Hojiko>A special exception just for the lady...? Wait, just a
moment, what exactly does that mean...?
\N<Ryuda Soldier>Hojiko, as a combatant, you have the duty to be informed.

\N<Ryuda Soldier>For this battle, as a special exception, regardless of the
outcome, Segi will have the obligation to provide night-time
services to the combatants.
\N<Hojiko>...Huh?
\N<Segi>...
\N<Hojiko>Regardless of the outcome... you say? Then... then...!?

\N<Ryuda Soldier>Of course, the outcome will be recorded in the military
service record. And naturally, this does not apply if either
party dies.

\N<Hojiko>So, in other words, as long as you survive... that's what it
means...!

\N<Hojiko>Heh, heh...! Ever since this training session started, I've
been thinking about nothing but negative things, but it
seems my luck is finally turning around...!
\N<Hojiko>Now I'm starting to feel a bit more motivated...!
\N<Segi>...

\N<Ryuda Soldier>Now, normally we would move straight to the match venue, but
before that, I have some good news for you.
\N<Segi>Good news...?
\N<Hojiko>What's that about...?

\N<Ryuda Soldier>You both are as good as amateurs, having never received
combat training and not possessing any physical advantage
over each other.
\N<Hojiko>...

\N<Ryuda Soldier>Therefore, a compassionate measure from Lord Zuuteruka has
been decided upon. Listen carefully.
\N<Segi>...

\N<Zuuteruka>Hehehe, normally there's a certain obligation imposed on
both warriors when they fight on this training ground.

\N<Zuuteruka>But this time, I'll make an exception and exempt you from
it. The reason is as the soldier there just explained.

\N<Zuuteruka>Well, you might not quite get it yet, but there's no need to
worry about it now. You'll understand it eventually after
the fight is over, whether you like it or not.

\N<Zuuteruka>Instead, focus on the battle before you now. If you lose
here, there's no future or tomorrow for you.
\N<Segi>...

\N<Ryuda Soldier>That's all for the announcement. Both parties should start
preparing.

\N<Zuuteruka>Ah, Segi. You stay behind for a bit; there's something I
want to talk about.

\N<Segi>...Coincidentally, I also have something I want to ask
before the battle.
\N<Zuuteruka>Hehehe, how are you feeling? Scared stiff?
\N<Segi>Don't be ridiculous... I'm not afraid anymore.

\N<Zuuteruka>...Impressive stuff. Mind. Even with Ryuda administered, it
doesn't mean you suddenly become strong. It doesn't mean you
can suddenly stand up to a burly man.

\N<Zuuteruka>Physical strength varies from person to person and between
genders. In other words, everyone has their limits.

\N<Zuuteruka>Mind. Ryuda is merely designed to maximize the body's intake
and absorption of substances specialized or suited for
physical enhancement, creating conditions in the body to
become stronger.

\N<Zuuteruka>So what this means is that your body is now more receptive
to being enhanced. Resistance to the ruins' toxic air is one
aspect of that.

\N<Segi>...I suppose so. It would be ridiculous if my slender arms
suddenly became muscular.

\N<Segi>I understand that much. That's why... I'm concerned about
the recent changes in my body.

\N<Zuuteruka>Hehehe... Is that what you wanted to ask about? Then it
seems the erosion is going smoothly.
\N<Segi>...What do you mean?

\N<Zuuteruka>Mind. Ryuda has two effects... In addition to the physical
enhancement I talked about earlier, there's another one.
\N<Segi>...

\N<Zuuteruka>For men, it has a violent excitatory effect... which greatly
increases their combat power. On the other hand, for women,
it comes with an aphrodisiac effect that can't be resisted
by mere concepts like reason or morality.

\N<Segi>An... aphrodisiac effect...? Then... the recent changes in
my body are...!?

\N<Zuuteruka>That's right, it's what has been eroding your body day by
day. That is the aphrodisiac effect caused by the erosion of
Mind. Ryuda.
\N<Segi>Wait... Why... Why didn't you tell me this!?

\N<Zuuteruka>Don't get me wrong. Neither Ryuda's main force nor I am your
ally or a sympathetic ear, you know? We're not going to act
favorably just because we understand your feelings and
ideals.
\N<Segi>Ku...!?

\N<Zuuteruka>First off... Even if you knew about it, would you have
refused the administration of Mind. Ryuda? Would you have
accepted the news of your ineligibility to participate in
the training corps and given up on your husband and son?
\N<Segi>That is...

\N<Zuuteruka>The path you chose is such a path. Don't start flailing
about now.

\N<Zuuteruka>Hehehe, fortunately, the effects are clearly visible. You
might as well fight with confidence.
\N<Segi>...

\N<Zuuteruka>Hehehe, you look utterly unconvinced. But this is also a
condition for your sake, you know?

\N<Segi>Don't joke with me... How can such an absurd condition be
for my sake?

\N<Zuuteruka>You must have felt it too, right? If left alone, Mind. Ryuda
will destroy your spirit and reason, and eventually go
berserk.

\N<Zuuteruka>When that happens, you'll become nothing more than a whore
who spreads her legs drooling at the sight of any man.
\N<Segi>Wha...!!??

\N<Zuuteruka>Mind. Ryuda creates a certain state of excitement... It
particularly erodes the host's mind after events like combat
or sexual intercourse.

\N<Zuuteruka>In other words, being embraced by your opponent after a
battle can suppress the erosion to some extent. It makes
sense, hehehe.

\N<Zuuteruka>Well, I could embrace you each time to calm you down. But if
the main force aims to boost the morale of the training
corps, it's most efficient to let your opponent take on that
role.
\N<Segi>Ugh...!

\N<Zuuteruka>And... don't forget? If the aphrodisiac effect of Mind.
Ryuda progresses as expected, in a few dozen days... right
before the final stage of the training corps, it will show
its true worth.

\N<Zuuteruka>What that true worth is... you'll come to understand it
firsthand with your own body.

\N<Zuuteruka>The day before the fateful battle... What will become of you
then? With those irresistible urges, what will you do?

\N<Zuuteruka>Will you spread your legs for a man whose name you don't
even know to calm yourself down? Or will you mount someone
else and climax in ecstasy?

\N<Zuuteruka>Or perhaps... will you suppress those urges thinking of
Yuia?
\N<Segi>...

\N<Zuuteruka>Now then, now that we've settled our talk, let's move on to
the stage. Make sure you have no regrets, alright?
A
air06
air05
\N<Segi>...

\N<Ryuda Soldier>Loser Segi, you were defeated by Hojiko in the first battle
of the training soldiers' assembly. You know what happens to
the losers, don't you?
\N<Segi>Th-that... is...
\N<Ryuda Soldier>...
\N<Segi>...

\N<Ryuda Soldier>Answer me. What rights does the victor hold over the loser
in the training soldiers' assembly?
\N<Segi>The... the victor has the right to...
\N<Segi>...

\N<Ryuda Soldier>It's fine if you can't put it into words as long as you
understand.

\N<Ryuda Soldier>Now, head to the treatment room on those legs of yours. And
welcome the victor.
\N<Segi>...
ホジコ

\N<Segi>...

\N<Ryuda Soldier>Segi, you emerged victorious against Hojiko in the first
battle of the training soldiers' assembly. But you do
understand what you must do next, don't you?
\N<Segi>Th-that... is...
\N<Ryuda Soldier>...
\N<Segi>...

\N<Ryuda Soldier>Answer me. What is it that you are supposed to do to your
opponent in the training soldiers' assembly?
\N<Segi>...

\N<Ryuda Soldier>It's fine if you can't put it into words, as long as you
understand.

\N<Ryuda Soldier>Now, head straight to the treatment room with those legs of
yours. And welcome your opponent.
\N<Segi>...
